content: I'm so excited! :D The 1.56 beta is branching off today, and everything we wanted to be in the 2021 stabilization and much more made it in time! :tada:
Amazing!!!! Congrats everyone! :tada:
Special thanks to @Mara @nikomatsakis @Eric Huss and others who really did amazing work here!
wooohooo--- although we may have to backport one thing for RFC 2229 closures :)
More than that, probably. Not sure I'll get to the version bump today, might be first thing tomorrow. But, in any case, good to hear we're on track.
I'm still a bit unclear on what needs to get done for the reference
Perhaps we should try to sneak in fixes for the edition guide. Pretty low priority but also should be very easy.
I wanted to help out with that, though it's been hard to make the time
almost all links to the edition guide go to the nightly version, so small fixes and updates don't really need to land in the same version directly. the most important stuff is there alreaady
Ah yes, you mentioned that already. Ok cool. I will try to make time to do that in the coming days though.
@Mara thank you for going through and making sure that things that passed FCP got in in time.

nikomatsakis said:

I'm still a bit unclear on what needs to get done for the reference

@nikomatsakis I'm sorry if it was unclear. I tried posting a few times what needs to be done. The list is here: https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3AA-edition-2021, and I tried to add instructions on how to update each one. If those instructions aren't clear, please let me know.

Would it help to try to reach out to find others that can help here?

(FWIW, I'd still like t-lang's help reviewing PRs for 2018 edition changes as well.)
@Eric Huss I think you've been clear, I'm just slow to follow up
thanks for giving the link again though!
I'm unclear more because I haven't done my homework
